Reviews.Title: “Oh my, bad neighborhood, bad everything else”
Reviews.Author: Travel_To_Travel
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump. It is not worth staying here for the price. The rooms are filthy. The water in the entire hotel wasn't working. The "suites" are plain old hotel rooms. This is in a bad neighborhood, with bums hanging around outdoors. Do you really want to risk this? How anyone could call this "nice" at any price must be used to sleeping in a dirt floor hovel. And BTW, they were actually quite nice at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Never book this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Urs B
Reviews.Content: It is all faked. Don`t book the Hotel. It is dirty, the bed towels are used and not cleand. They trheat you like you are not welcome on the front desk and are not helpfull. they are arrogant and not willingfule to help. The whole hotel does not deserve the name as a hotel. Never book it. Trust me.

Reviews.Title: “Cheapest in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: shawchessplayer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because it was the cheapest available within walking distance of downtown Toronto. It was OK for a night, but I am glad it wasn't any longer. The rooms are really dated and tired. The electric wire for the extractor ran along the top of out headboard. The room was over the downstairs cafe, and really smelled of food. On the plus side - the reception area is nice, and we sat outside in the evening for a drink. The free breakfast was OK, a nice thing for a Hotel to offer

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: Jen_Ha
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while a family member was in hospital...got the University Hospital Network special rate, and paid aprox $60/night. Room was tiny, but clean, and had everything we needed. This is a very basic place, but staff was friendly, and we felt safe. Parking was across the street, and we had no problems using this service. Gabby’s restaurant in the lower level was very good. It was a $12 cab ride to the hospital, but this we preferred this to staying closer to the hospital area (was much cheaper for parking and lodging as well – and seemed safer in our opinion) We would stay here again, if need be. Very nice to have had a decent place on a tight budget during a very stressful time for our family.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother unless you like sharing with rodents!”
Reviews.Author: Emma W
Reviews.Content: We booked a three night stay through hotwire for $70/night and even though we got a bargain price I still wouldn't stay here again! It was supposed to be in a "downtown" location, when in actual fact it was at least a 30 minute walk to Dundas & Yonge. It is however close to the subway, so you can get around that way. There were no parking places left when we arrived, so we had to park just down the road at a public carpark for $12/24 hrs with a $20 deposit, which we later found out is $3 cheaper than the hotel charges anyway. The lobby and bar area were clean and inviting, which is more than can be said for the guy on the desk when we checked in. The lift is small and broke down several times, so we were forced to endure the horrible "cooked oil" smell coming from the basement restaurant that lingers permanently on the stairs. The room was small and dark. The walls and carpet were stained and someone had punched a hole in the wall. On the upside at least the bed sheets were clean and bed bug free as far as we were aware. Wired internet connection in the room, but we found that we also picked up the lobby wireless connection, though this was very unreliable (even when sat in the lobby itself). The bathroom was tiny. The door almost touched the sink when it was open so in order to use any of the facilities you had to go in and then close the door behind you, which was awkward and would have been impossible for a larger person. Breakfast was minimal - choice of cereals, toast, muffins & fresh fruit with orange juice & coffee. Then the icing on the cake, we came back late one afternoon to get ready to go out for the evening, to find a mouse in our room! We complained to a female receptionist who was very apologetic, but not surprised (so obviously this was not a one off), they offered to compensate us a night and said they would send someone up to "chase the mouse out". No offer to change rooms and in the end no one came up while we were there, but as it happened the mouse ran out of his own accord - he obviously didn't want to spend another night in the room either!!! So while it's cheap the Isabella is far from cheerful and if you can afford to pay a little extra I'd find a hotel either in Chinatown or closer to the Dundas & Yonge area with free parking, because what extra you spend on the hotel you'll save on parking and subway fares etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very good at the price I paid, but probably not for the official price”
Reviews.Author: marcparis60
Reviews.Content: I am surprised by the negative reviews. My room (605) was clean and bedbug free. The shower room was more than adequate, with a large shower with a window, which was nice. The double bed (I paid for a single) was comfortable, and the bed and bath linen was changed daily. There was no minibar, but a small fridge was avaiable, which was very handy. The windows didn't open, but the air conditioning worked well. The room was quiet and comfortable. The room had a chest of drawers but no closet, just a clothes rail. Not all TV channels were available. The free ethernet worked well for the first 7 days of my stay, but there were problems the last day when a new access code had to be entered. The front desk said I had to call Bell DataValet customer service, which was effective, but long. Having free local calls is a plus. The location is fine, just a few minutes from Sherbourne subway station, and on a major bus line on Sherbourne. My meetings were downtown, and I had a nice 20-min walk each day to get there. Breakfast was adequate, with cold cereals, muffins, scones, etc. You could eat at the lobby bar or the adjoining tables, or in the seating area sofas. My stay was fine, but I was paying about half the listed price. The listed price is high for the level of quality.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs. Balanced review”
Reviews.Author: matty101010
Reviews.Content: I got a deal through hotwire for three nights in this hotel during August. I stayed in 17 hotels/cheap motels during a trip across Canada and this was by far the worst. When we first got to the room it had potential. A fridge, nice shower and fair a/c. The problem is that the rooms are not cleaned properly and my bed had bugs. Lots of them!! I spent the night trying to kill them. I hardly slept and checked out straight away in the morning and booked another hotel. I did eventually manage to get a refund, but it ruined an entire day of my holiday. Bed bugs impact all hotels to some degree but it would appear that they are not prepared to deal with the problem. Had it not been for the bugs and the attitude of the staff the hotel has a lot of potential, particularly the location. While you may get a good room as noted in some of the reviews, you are equally likely to a room like the one I did. I would give it a miss

Reviews.Title: “I don't know what people are complaining about”
Reviews.Author: J M
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel through hotwire for 4 nights at $95/night (approx), mainly because it was the cheapest option. On the trip down we read the reviews on Trip Advisor, started to panic and make plans to try and get out of our deal. In the end decided to stay at least one night in the supposed bed-bug infested slum of a hotel that the reviews on Trip Advisor told us to expect, and were pleasantly surprised that it was nothing like that. The staff at the front desk were helpful, the room was clean and quiet and when we asked for extra pillows we got them in short order. They did take a $50 deposit from us when we checked in, but they never charged my credit card for it. For a hotel, we slept well every night. We stayed on the seventh floor and it was small but we weren't there to spend time in a hotel room watching TV. The bathroom was very small. When I sat on the toilet, the sink was right in my face. Perhaps this hotel is not a good option for larger people. In terms of location, it was pretty good: we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go and explore the neighbourhoods along the way. The continental breakfast was alright, too: we're not coffee drinkers, but the fruit was fresh and the muffins didn't taste too bad. We grabbed some food there every morning. Overall, a very pleasant experience and good value for the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Bestseller_77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Isabella for One Night i was a real disappointment.... Minus: Wifi and Elevator did Not work Tiniest bed i ever slept in (double bed extra Charge of 45 bucks) Breakfeast Toast and empty Coffee Floms Dark and Small with no fresh Air So please go somewhere Else if You Want to Safe the hastle

Reviews.Title: “Small but good!”
Reviews.Author: pugachev1
Reviews.Content: We got a great price on Hotwire for it. But, then read all the negative reviews and got a bit panicked. However, we were pleasantly surprised. Yes. the room was small, but comfortable. Very clean, great shower, comfortable bed. Only negative was water stain on the ceiling. The staff at the front desk was GREAT and very friendly. On the day we checked out, we had a 1/2 hour chat with the desk clerk over a more than adequate free breakfast. The neighborhood is not as bad as people posted. It is only two blocks from a subway station, right on the main bus line, coffee shops and restaurants within walking distance. If you are visiting the city to see the city this is worth the price. If you want to spend your time in your hotel room while there, then book somewhere else. But, if you are looking for the basics and want easy access to Toronto, then I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hideous Room Hideous Service”
Reviews.Author: raskolnikova
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry it has taken me so long to write a review for this place--perhaps I could have saved some people from making the calamitous mistake of staying here. I booked this hotel through a certain website that doesn't allow you to see where you'll be staying until it's too late. The room was about the size of a large broom closet with a gloomy and shady looking biker-type at the reception desk. Incidentally, don't be fooled by the lobby as it is not a reflection of the rooms. The hallways smelled of stale cigarette smoke and/or McDonald's cheeseburgers. I walk in ant one of the first things I notice is how tiny the washroom is. And dirty! There were literally dead insects on the floor. I opened up the bed to reveal pillows with hairs on them as well as dirty sheets and a duvet with various stains and cigarette burns. When I went to reception and asked for a change of sheets and explained the state of the bed the clerk didn't bat an eyelash and proceeded to give me another set of sheets--that also had stains and holes in them. Long story shorter--I spent the night sat on a chair waiting for the sun to come up and got myslef out of there at to a Travelodge which in comparison, seemed like the Ritz. Also, the breakfast is pathetic. I took a banana and ran. Avoid!

Reviews.Title: “A few shortcomings but I'll definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: cdnlindaloo
Reviews.Content: Location is about 1 1/2 blocks south of Sherbourne subway station. Good restaurant/bar/patio attached. Staff is friendly and very helpful. Breakfast included 3 cereals, juices, coffee, milk, muffins, buns, toast, etc., apples & bananas. Wireless internet in rooms (get cable from front desk). Tiny elevator. Carpet stained in room, outside windows of room dirty (7th floor), but otherwise room and bathroom clean. Very small bathroom but large shower glassed in. Air conditioning in 701 worked well. Good mattress and quiet at night. Easy walk to all sorts of restaurants on Church St. Tour bus (double decker, hop-on-hop-off) provided pick-up at hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Double lock your door!”
Reviews.Author: foot2cranium
Reviews.Content: Pros Nice enough lobby; close to subway and td bank; had a fridge Cons I heard it is in a rough neighbourhood; room is very small (no room for a chair for guests) bathroom is tiny and limited privacy (door wouldn't latch shut); carpet was stained (by bleach?); temperature control didn't work for more than just our room (suffered 26 degrees first night-heard another guest complain); Limited pay parking ($15/night if available); FRONT DESK MAN UNLOCKED AND CAME INTO OUR ROOM AT 2 AM CLAIMING HE THOUGHT WE CHECKED OUT!! (HE WASN'T THERE TO CLEAN AND THE ROOM WAS 4TH FLOOR); $50 deposit is required; concerns were not addressed adequately by front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Woke up covered in insect bites”
Reviews.Author: bugbitten11
Reviews.Content: I didn't have insect bites when I went to the hotel. I slept in their BED and woke up the next morning covered in BUG bites. I'm not a doctor or an entomologist so I can't tell you for a fact what type of BUG bites I got in that BED. What I can say is that the next morning I went to reception told them what happened, and canceled the rest of my stay and demanded a refund. I spoke to the GM on the phone and she said they were having "computer problems" but would contact me today about a refund. No call of course. Just keep that in mind if you're thinking of staying at the Isabella.

Reviews.Title: “ok for Downtown i suppose but i think i could of found somewhere cheaper.”
Reviews.Author: varadero09
Reviews.Content: After searching internet for downtown hotels on a budget i decided this was the only one on my budget,Rooms were a little small but i suppose this was good for downtown Toronto,if i was to go again id use a hostel and drink the money i spent to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Lesson learned: splurge for an acceptable place to stay on vacation”
Reviews.Author: travel-enthusiast89
Reviews.Content: The rooms were extremely small with dirty sheets on the bed. The floor was also rather dirty. Located in a bad neighborhood. Parking is not included in room price. My suggestion for travelers visiting toronto is to stay in a more centrally located hotel for a little more money. Free wireless only available in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BertandCathie
Reviews.Content: great location about 1/2 hour to main centre of Toronto, public transport plentiful and reasonable

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for budget oriented travelers”
Reviews.Author: vacaycay
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location for people who need to use transit to get around. The sherbourne station is about 2 blocks north, and there is also a bus stop right outside heading south on sherbourne st. There is a restaurant downstairs (which I didn't try), and plenty of stores around for those who need to buy supplies (shopper's drug mart and a market across the street). There is a sub sandwich place across the street as well, and more restaurants closer to sherbourne station. First off, this a budget-oriented hotel so don't expect anything fancy. The location is what makes this place a good value. Wireless Internet is available for free in the lobby. If you want to use it in the room, I believe you need to pay extra. There is one elevator in the hotel. It can fit 4 slim people, or one person and their luggage. It is the tiniest elevator I've ever seen. But since the traffic wasn't high in this hotel during my stay, it was never a problem. I seldom ran into anyone else whenever I used it. There is also a stairwell that people can use if they are claustrophobic. As far as I know, there were no amenities like swimming pool or fitness room. Breakfast was included, and adds slightly to the value of this hotel. Again, don't expect anything elaborate. You'll get juice, cereal, bread with jam or butter, mini croissants, muffins and apples/bananas. The room was decent and comfortable. There was a small old TV to watch. It was fine for me, but those who are looking for a lavish room with a large screen LCD will not find that here. My room was also equipped with adjustable air conditioning and it worked well, but my room got a bit dry. My lips started cracking after a day or 2. For me, the only negative about the room was that the washroom was cramped - the shower was spacious, but the toilet bowl was directly in front of the sink - when I sat down on the toilet, I was looking directly at the side of the sink a few inches from my face. Still, the room was cozy, housekeeping was good, and location was great. I would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it says it is - a 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonRomey
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here and it's value for money. The area isn't the best and isn't in the centre but it's not that far away. Once you get your head around the fact that you are in a main city, it's quoted as being a 2 star and that's what you get. For somewhere to put your stuff, put your head down for the night and has basic amenities, (TV, hairdryer and decent shower) it's fine. If your happy with basic, then I recommend. If you want anymore than that then go somewhere else and pay more. It's what a 2 star hotel is so can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: Roadrunner06
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night, didn't sleep a wink because there was constant, incessant NOISE from the street until 5am...dogs barking, loud traffic, louder drunks. Bed was uncomfortable and sagged, reddish stains on edge of mattress and on boxspring (hoping it wasn't bedbugs). Room very tiny, only given two pillows, both way past prime. One bath towel for a double occupancy room???? Garbage under the bed..Parking $15 and not in the safest of neighbourhoods... I don't think we'll be staying again..thanks anyway :(

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: lesiku
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were in town for a concert, so I found this hotel online, and they were having an online special. $60 for the room. Awesome, considering I've paid more. The location was good because it was a block away from the subway, and on the bus route we needed to get to the concert. Upon check-in, they had spotted an overbooking issue, so we were bumped up to the "deluxe" suite. The deluxe suite was rather disappointing because it wasn't much different than any other run-of-the-mill hotel room, but a bar fridge is always appreciated. In retrospect, the concierge may have mislead us into thinking we got a deluxe suite because our amenities do not match what is listed on their website. In any case, it's the best hotel money can buy at $60 for downtown Toronto. We lucked out on that price. I will remain loyal!

Reviews.Title: “Good option if you don't have a car!”
Reviews.Author: CleoBs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Isabella Hotel for two nights. The position is good, we walked till Yonge St and Dundas Square and it was safe. The hotel is very simple and our room was very cleaned as well as our bathroom. Breakfast was ok. The person who greeted us on arrival was very kind (I belive the name was Alex and was from El Salvador). He gave us several suggestions about things to see/do. The only problem was the car. There are no free/convenient parking in Toronto. That one close to the hotel charged us 12$ for the first night (we arrived at midnight) and $24 for the second day! Another example: at the CN Tower, the parking lot by the stadium was empty and applied the "Event price" that was $25 even if there was nothing going on!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: LThomKitchener
Reviews.Content: Other than the parking and a few rowdy guests, this hotel was wonderful. The service at check in was great, he knew who I was before I checked -- very impressed. The location was perfect & the balcony off of our room overlooked their own resturant patio, perfect for people watching. Yes, the elevator is tiny and the parking was not convenient, but the room was spotless and the location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: loopygurl
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel for two nights (June 26&27, 2010) Found this place through Hotwire and was not disappointed. This is a small hotel on Sherbourne St. There are suites in the old "castle" part of the hotel and rooms in the newer building. We stayed in a room, although small, very comfortable and spotlessly clean. The staff was extraordinarily friendly and helpful. Continental breakfast is included, although we never went, so I do not know if it was good or not. There is a bar/tavern on-site "Gabby's". Great food and reasonably priced drinks, nice patio area as well. Subway station just a block away, or bus stop at hotel. You can get anywhere from this place quickly. A short walk takes you to a nearby park with giant squirrels to feed. It is a long walk to downtown but doable. My husband and I did it twice and used public transit to get back. There is a grocery store "No Frills", a "Shopper's Drug Mart", a Mr. Sub, an internet cafe, another tavern, and a few others thigs across the street. We really liked this place and will stay there again next time we go to Toronto. We typically travel within Canada for concerts. Went up to see the Scorpions at the Molson Ampitheatre!

Reviews.Title: “A good bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: mishcu
Reviews.Content: The Isabella hotel caters to business travellers and vacationers alike. It offers comfortable rooms at very reasonable rates. It is conveniently located, approximately fifteen minutes from the downtown core. The hotel offers a continental breakfast in the morning and has a neighbourhood pub that patrons can frequent prior to heading out for a night on the town. If on business, the hotel offers internet service and a quiet stay away from the hustle and bustle of the downtown core. A great place to relax after a long days work. Pharmacy and food shopping is conveniently located across the street. The staff is professional but also friendly and courteous. They are very helpful in accomodating patrons with any questions they may have. Whether you are there for a couple of days or your stay is long term the staff will ensure that everthing will be to your satisfaction. A cozy atmosphere whether you are here for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Good Time”
Reviews.Author: sammic88
Reviews.Content: Nice little place to stay.Only bad thing is it's away from everything.The staff was really good.They have a breakfast in the morning that is pretty good.On a nice morning can eat outside.The rooms are normal size and clean.They do not have parking so you need to put your car in a public garage.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice little place”
Reviews.Author: eBetances
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife found Isabella in the web and dared to check-in for a night after hunting apartments in downtown Toronto. Even if away from the tourist path and more like an Inn than a Hotel, IT WAS WORTH THE RISK! For 60 CAD a night we had a clean, tidy little room to shower and sleep after walking around. The complimentary breakfast was a welcomed plus before heading out the next day. It also has a restaurant with a limited but tasty menu and nice pub-like atmosphere. The room was tiny, yes, but more than comfy. So, we ended up extending our stay for another night and thinking about recommending it to our friends and anyone looking for a tidy room just to spend the night.

Reviews.Title: “YUCK!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerTat
Reviews.Content: glad i read the reviews regarding the bedbugs after we came home!! and extremely thankful to report i didn't see any on my recent stay. However - the room was extremely hot as another writer complained about so I feel confident in stating this is an on going problem. We switched rooms twice and both were dirty, floor hadn't been swept or vacuumed between guests. I have always had good luck using Priceline and booked this room through Hotwire, so I have learned my lesson and won't be using Hotwire again. This was at best student hostel nowhere close to the description of a boutique hotel. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. It was overpriced, dirty, small and hot. Not a pleasant stay. To add insult to injury front desk people were rude!!! Breakfast was terrible the so called buffet table didn't have spills wiped and was dirty as the room. We didn't eat anything it just looked dirty. And poorly supplied, look like some picked over danishes and cheap bread. not recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “And, now the truth”
Reviews.Author: gadfly101
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent visitor to the Isabella, I travel alone and feel 100% safe. One of the other reasons I like it is for the parking! When I visit Toronto, I like to park my car and leave it parked. This is a great location because the subway is right there, as is great municipal parking on Selby. Selby is less than a city block away, and you can pay for days parking with your credit card, if you like. There is no reason to have to run in and out to feed a parking meter. If you are luck enough to get one of the hotel's 5 parking spots, bonus. If not, it really is not a problem. Yes, the rooms are small. Yes, the rooms are tired, but the beds are comfortable, and the rooms are clean. If the maid service is a bit late, it is because the place is busy! The front desk staff are great, always helpful and pleasant. I too have melted during the night only to find out that I wasn't using the A/C unit correctly. The front desk staff have promised to make this info available to new visitors. I too, have had the room with the 'squeeze in' bath room, and simply requested that I don't get it any more. I had the same problem in a room in the King Eddy! The problem of on-site food has also been solved. There is a very comfortable, clean, affordable, licenced restaurant downstairs that opens for dinner. Breakfast is available at the Groundhog, one block away on Bloor and it is also a great find. The (tiny) elevator takes you right to the restaurant, so you don't even have to leave the hotel (or take your slippers off!).

Reviews.Title: “Very small room”
Reviews.Author: sw_tester
Reviews.Content: I am not a very fussy traveler and normally any one of the issues that I had with this hotel would not be enough for me to be disappointed. On the plus side ... I did not have any bed bugs. I did ask at the front desk and they assured me that the problem had been fixed. The location was pretty good. It was only a few blocks to the subway and I did not feel uncomfortable walking to the hotel at night. This hotel was a little run down, but it was not in too bad a condition. My room was fairly clean. There was a headband and rubber band on the carpet, so it had likely not been vacuumed since the last visitor, but the bathroom was clean and there was no smell to the room. The room was quite small but there was a small closet and a dresser and enough room to move around the bed. Luckily I was alone otherwise it would have been very cramped. The bathroom had a shower only (not a problem) but the room was so small that I had to be a contortionist to get to the toilet past the sink and shower (if I weighed over 300 pounds I would not have been able to make it to the toilet). Once seated, my knees were under the sink by about 8 inches. My room was quite warm (26 C) despite the air conditioner being "on" and set to a reasonable temperature. I tried turning the thermostat down but there was no change. Luckily I could open the window a little bit, but I had to use a coffee mug to keep it open. I complained in the morning and the person at the front desk said that they had problems with the AC in the small rooms and asked if I wanted him to reset the AC unit? I told him that I had turned the thermostat down and he said not to worry because the AC would only run for a while before tripping again anyway. My room was not "made up" during my two night stay, which I thought a little strange in a regular hotel like this one. The breakfast was OK but pretty sparse. With all of these issues, I would NOT recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “avoid!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jaguargod
Reviews.Content: i should have listened to the last guy who wrote a review saying there were bed bugs. because THERE ARE!! we had them walking on us within five minutes of sitting down on the bed. one even bit my wifes backside!!!! and add to that dirty water glasses, dirty coffee maker, mold around the shower stall, and a hair on the DIRTY sheets that was not ours... just do yourself a favour...spend an extra few bucks and upgrade to a better hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't look closely”
Reviews.Author: Jenmonton
Reviews.Content: Bugs in the bed. Didn't sweep the bathroom floor - so hair everywhere. I thought it was a pleasant surprise at first, but yikes!

Reviews.Title: “Location is fine, cleanliness could be better”
Reviews.Author: princesszelda
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights during our summer holiday last year. The hotel staff is friendly, the location and surroundings felt safe and subway is nearby. We could park our car across the street in an open, but gated parking lot (for a fee). Our (2-star, so no frills or extras) rooms were fairly quiet. There was not much street noise, but some noise from the hallway and nearby guest rooms. There were stains in the carpet and on the sheets. The bathroom was the same. There was a small breakfast buffet in the morning. If you can get a low price, this is a good enough hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: kewkc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Isabella for a mixed business/leisure trip. I was worried after reading the reviews, but I booked under the "winter special" pricing. The location is a bit scrappy, but coming back to the hotel later at night was not a problem - it does feel a bit unsafe for a single woman traveller like myself, but the hotel is a quick five minute walk from the subway and as a plus, just across from a supermarket. Check in was no problem, brisk and efficient. The room itself was clean. It was a double bed room with a smallish tv, a desk, and a refrigerator. The bathroom was quite small, just a shower and the toilet - virtually no counter space. A few quirks during my stay was the internet - $5 a night, only accessible by ethernet cable, and it kept kicking me off of the net. There were a few loud guests on the other side. The room, while clean felt worn. Also breakfast is pretty basic, juice/coffee a few breads and cereals. Bottom line though, it was good value for money and the location is close to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: feltephant
Reviews.Content: Where do I start!? 1) We booked our reservation a month beforehand by contacting the property directly. We liked the price, location and look of the place. Well, those three things stayed the same but when we arrived we were told that they had overbooked. So our reservation was gone, as well as our reserved parking spot. They apologized profusely but we were on our own to find parking (ended up finding parking across the street beneath the grocery store, which actually turned out to be cheaper than reserving one with the hotel). They were out of regular rooms, but offered to upgrade us to a suite for no charge to fix their mistake. 2) A suite! Sounds nice until we got in there and realized it was clearly an old storage room converted into a "suite". It sat on the ground floor (all the other rooms were upstairs) between the stairwell and the laundry room with lovely views of the alley! See attached pictures of this laughable "suite". I didn't get a picture of the bathroom, which was actually quite large and nice. 3) Aside from the fact that the room was sub par, we found moldy ice cream in the fridge and only two pillows on the bed. That evening before turning in I walked over to the front desk and was ignored for awhile by the employee behind the desk, who was busy laughing with his friend, who was lounging across the way in the lobby. When he finally finished up, I asked for an extra pillow or two. He said I could find them in the drawer of our dresser. I felt pretty stupid because I hadn't even looked there. So I went back, looked in the dresser and found... two pillowcases? Not helpful. I went back to the desk, was ignored again and was finally told he'd find some pillows and bring them to my room in a while. This he did. In a while. Why was it so difficult? I guess they have a pillow shortage as well as a room shortage. 4) This is a weird one: You're not allowed to bring the continental breakfast to your room. What? Maybe this is standard practice at some places but this has been the first place I've stayed at where they didn't allow me to grab a bagel and orange juice and go back to my room. This is not necessarily a deal breaker I just thought it was strange. Are we four years old? Can't be trusted with food in our room? Might smear it on the walls? Otherwise, it was clean, right by the train station and looked cute from the outside. The price would have been good had we gotten the room we reserved, instead of a converted storage space. Our experience was pretty lame, but I wouldn't count this hotel out for everyone else because it's possible we just had bad luck. We won't stay there again, though. The Holiday Inn down the street was just as cute and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price....Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller4ever
Reviews.Content: I was really nervous about booking this hotel because I never heard of it, and after reading the most recent reviews, I was very skeptical! The rooms were small, but they were clean and comfortable. I was there for the film festival, so I only was in my room to sleep, not hang out. The breakfast in the morning was what one would expect of a continental breakfast: muffins, toast, coffe, juice, fruit, etc. Considering the price, it was good :-) I took a chance booking this hotel because it was close to everything, and affordable. After staying there I read the other reviews and wondered if those people would pay twice the amount of money to stay in a hotel with bigger rooms and a more vast breakfast. I'm not big on breakfast, or the size of my room. I'd rather save money on the hotel and spend what I saved enjoying the city! But that's just me,.,,,,,,so if you want a good location, for a cheap price....that's clean and comfortable, then this is your place. If you want high end luxury, try the Four Seasons or something, it's only like $500 a night!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “There ARE better options”
Reviews.Author: Atlanta_Professor
Reviews.Content: This hotel was "okay," given the discounted rate I got through Expedia. But, had I booked directly and paid their full daily rate I would have been disappointed. Rooms in this hotel are very small and very basic. The "suites" are about the size of standard room in "better" hotels. They won't guarantee a non-smoking room if you don't book directly, and I ended up stuck in a smoking room, where I found cigarette burns on the bedding! Yuck! The place is quite clean, but shabby, and showing its age. In the first room I was given, the air conditioning was not working. I must commend them for moving quickly to put me in another room. However, as I noted above, they gave me a smoking room, even though I asked for non-smoking. In my new room, the air conditioning just barely worked. Had we had a real heat wave, I am sure I would have been miserable. The windows don't open in their small standard rooms in the tower, which made for a stuffy feeling. Breakfast is included in the rate, although it is quite basic: cold cereal, bread and pastries, so-so coffee, watery juice, and fruit (though I can't see what the point was of providing rock-hard green bananas!). The local neighbourhood is somewhat "edgy," and some travellers might feel uneasy walking around at night. However, public transit is close-by, and one can easily walk to the nearby Church and Wellesley "gay village", Yonge Street, etc. It's nice that there is a drugstore and bargain grocery store right across the road, where you can stock up on odds and ends for the small fridge in your room. I didn't "hate" this place, but I can't really recommend it, and won't myself stay there again. One can find better hotels for the same price (or even less). In the past, I have stayed at the Days Inn on Carlton Street, and it is much better for about the same price (on average).

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: gagz135
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here on New Year's Eve 2008. First of all, there is really no reliable parking at the hotel. The closest parking is on the street, which the hotel workers didn't recommend because f Toronto's notorious fetish for towing cars. We had a park underground in a ramp in a not at all well lit/nice looking neighborhood. Very scary. This was underneath the grocery store across the street from the hotel. The room we stayed in had a queen bed, and a tv. That's all there was really room for. The TV sat atop the dresser and the mini-bar/fridge wasn't even plugged in until I had to do it myself. The bathroom was very small, and the door would hit the toilet every time it was opened. They were happy to call us a cab, which never came however, but it wasn't hard to get a cab on the corner (right outside the hotel). They were also very helpful in giving us a wake-up call. There is a free continental breakfast which actually was better than expected. Definitely not for families, however.

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: kym72
Reviews.Content: Isabella Hotel and Suites is located on the corner of Sherbourne and Isabella Streets in Downtown Toronto. Driving down Sherbourne from the main expressway certainly had us concerned as it is a very rough neighborhood with lots of graffiti and homeless people. The neighborhood seems to improve as you get to the Isabella. We chose a room with a queen size bed and the room was beyond tiny for $130 a night but it was very clean and quite comfortable. Even though our used towels were left on the floor we did not get clean ones. The temp in our room did not go above 67 degrees farenheit even though it was set at 90. We had to request another blanket to keep warm. I was fairly satisfied with the room considering most hotels in Toronto were over $200 a night. The Isabella was clean and the staff seemed very helpful. I would recommend this hotel to people who are looking for no frills accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Overall OK, but there were some glitches”
Reviews.Author: cltong482
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Isabella during our recent visit to Toronto. The hotel is clean, convenient and affordable. However, the staff wasn't very helpful nor did it seem like they knew what they were doing. When we arrived, they lost our room and parking reservation because their system crashed. Luckily they had a room available for us - but we didn't get a parking space. So we had to park on the streets, and get up at the crack of dawn to feed the meter every two hours. In addition, our room was incredibly HOT. The thermometer appeared to be broken, and when we asked the staff to fix it, they always claimed they did. We lived in 82 degrees heat for the 3 nights we were in Isabella. The cleaning lady also came at weird times. One day, she could come early in the afternoon to clean, but other times, the room still wasn't cleaned when we came back at 5 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a positive experience”
Reviews.Author: traceypooh
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weekend stay in Toronto, where we stayed at the Isabella Hotel and Suites. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. The hotel is very nice looking from the outside, a pretty building with a nice patio for sitting outside and enjoying a drink (which you can do, as there is a bar in the lobby). It seemed to be in a generally safe neighborhood (we saw a young woman jogging by herself after dark, and there were several people out and about on Friday evening). The man at the front desk, Dann, was extremely welcoming and gave us some very good tips for things to do around the city. We had some great conversation with him the first night we were there. The rest of the staff was also very friendly and helpful, and there was free continental breakfast in the morning. Our room was small, but that was fine with us. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was very clean and modern. Our only complaint with the room was that the carpet needed to be replaced...badly. There was a large splattery stain on the carpet just next to the bed, which was a bit off-putting. The only other thing that was less than ideal was the parking...the hotel has only 5 parking spaces, which are generally full unless you reserve them when you book your room (calling the day you are to arrive does not work). Thus, you must park in one of the public parking lots. There is a garage across the street from the hotel, which we used the first night, but we then discovered a municipal lot only about 2 blocks down the street (on Sherbourne between Wellesley and Carlton) that was cheaper to park in. Expect to pay about $15-20 per day for parking either way. Other than the carpet and the parking though, we had a good experience at this hotel. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “what it lacks in charm”
Reviews.Author: txmockbird13
Reviews.Content: Neighborhood could use some TLC but the subway is close as is Bloor street, cabbagetown neighborhood is about a 1/2 hour walk away. Room was clean but tiny as was the bath, and elevator had to be taken one at a time when coming and going with bags. Quiet at night ... if your staying soon beware of construction across the street that starts at 7:30 am .. and they are getting ready to start a big condo development about a block away ... desk staff friendly.. if your on a budget, not a bad choice. went to the groundhog pub on a recommendation of another review, a nice close option for a cold beer and nice service

Reviews.Title: “Good, with some minuses”
Reviews.Author: Allstonian
Reviews.Content: Based on other reviews on this site, we knew that one fault at this hotel has been that some people couldn't get the grade of room on check-in that they had booked in advance. We were arriving late on a Friday night, so we made a point of telephoning a few days before to confirm that we would be arriving, and to confirm our room grade (a regular suite.) We booked the regular suite specifically because suites have queen beds and the standard rooms have double beds (according to the hotel's website.) My husband is 6' 6" and a double bed is too short! On check-in, the desk clerk directed us to a room on the ground floor which he said was a *deluxe* suite. We were dismayed to find that it could only be called a suite because it had one room for a sofabed (not in the best condition), the television, and a mini-fridge, and a separate tiny room for the DOUBLE bed. The room also had no remote for the TV, an iron but no ironing board, and no coffeemaker. (The coffeemaker which was provided the next day, along with the other missing items, did not work...) Even worse, when my husband went to the front desk to ask if we could change rooms, he ended up in a shouting match with the desk clerk, who insisted that we were in a deluxe suite, and that the bed in question was so a queen! (I actually took the trouble to measure the bed and look up bed size specifications the next day. It was a double.) Needless to say, we spent a rather uncomfortable night crowded into this small bed. The next morning my husband spoke with a different desk clerk, who was mortified to hear of our trouble and promised to move us to a proper suite on Sunday at noon, which was the soonest that onewould become available. The first desk clerk also apologized to my husband for the argument, although he did try to excuse the problem by saying that the hotel had been overbooked and he "thought he was doing us a favor." And the suite into which we were moved was exactly what we'd expected from the description of the hotel's suites, with the promised queen bed, desk, tub/shower combo, and *working* coffeemaker. The carpet was badly stained, but the room was otherwise pristine and very well maintained by housekeeping. The rest of our stay was quite enjoyable. I only wish that we hadn't gotten off to such an awkward start!

Reviews.Title: “last of the oldtimers”
Reviews.Author: Sweetpea2529
Reviews.Content: The Isabella has a bus on the corner and a subway three blocks away that takes you everywhere quickly and easily. The continental breakfast is more than adequate and the informal breakfasting arrangements, with newspapers always available, create a pleasant start for the day. Our room was clean, quiet and comfortable, with plenty of storage space. Desk staff were friendly and helpful. Good value, nice ambience, we'd stay there again !.We had a suite, so had an advantage over the regular rooms that are smaller.

Reviews.Title: “Not at ALL what we expected!”
Reviews.Author: Samadigun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Isabella Suites from August 5 to August 6, 2007. Not having stayed in many hotels in Toronto, we were trusting the accuracy of the pictures and depiction of the amenities to be representative. This did NOT turn out to be the case. First, we were lucky to get one of only 5 parking spaces available across the street from the hotel. If we didn't get one, we have no idea how far we would have had to park or how much it would have cost. Parking was $15. The lobby and other common areas of the hotel are very clean. The elevator is very small and could not accomodate more than two people with their luggage. Now comes the big let down....We opened the door to our room and discovered that our 'suite' was the tiniest hotel room EVER! For $124 our room was approximately 10 feet by 12 feet, including the 'nook' for the double bed, the 'closet', and the mini fridge and tv. The washroom, although very clean and appearing to be newer, featured stand up shower only and was no more than 8 feet by 5 feet. One good thing: The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful and got us checked in quickly. Overall, our experience was fine because we had a good time in Toronto. But we would absolutely NOT recommend this hotel and certainly do not find it to be anywhere close to good value for the money. And we don't know what the true definition of 'suites' is, but we're pretty sure this isn't it! Having said all that, there is a nice little place called The Groundhog Pub just around the corner on Bloor Street and our bartender, Alesha, was awesome. Thanks....

Reviews.Title: “A Sparkling Gem!”
Reviews.Author: ColeHeather
Reviews.Content: My honey and I stayed here while we were looking for an apartment to rent. After our 5 hour drive it was wonderful to have a `home` we could go back to and re-group! Friendly staff, fair rates, clean, and charming. We liked the area and will be moving in Near the hotel we stayed. We plan to encourage family to stay there if we don`t have enough room for everyone! Buisness or pleasure, the rooms are great, the suites and luxtury (tower floor). Highly Recomended!

Reviews.Title: “Great SMALL, Boutique Hotel in Dowtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Gotpride
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Isabella for the last weekend of Toronto Pride 2007 Friday - Monday. Upon checking in, I found the desk staff to be excellent, super friendly and most accomodating. The lobby itself was adorable with a small outdoor patio and bar area. Complimentary Continental Breakfast was offered daily from 8 - 10 AM. The rooms are on the small side, but impeccably clean. The bathrooms would not be good for anyone larger than average or smaller than average build and the layout in my room was a bit odd, when seated on the toilet, your knees were under the pedestal sink. Make no mistake, this is not a hotel with huge rooms, amenities and all the bells and whistles, but a great place to get some R & R away from the hustle and bustle of big city life in Toronto, I even found the location to be very calming in a somewhat seemingly residential area. The location was super close to the Pride Celebration on Church and for travel closer to the Eaton Centre, etc, the Subway was right dwon the street. Desk staff as I said were fanatastic, Lisa was there most of the weekend and I found her to be an absolute delight at every encounter that we had with her! I definitely plan to stay at the Isabella again for the Pride 2008 Celebration!

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: HomeSweetHome111
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what I wanted...small, affordable, clean, and conveniently located. I got lucky because it had all that, and a great staff too! For the rates, and the location this is definitely gonna be where I stay now. Beats the commute home sometimes after work, especially when the GO Train is down.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: kickers_fan
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my parents visiting from Germany, who stayed for 10 days, and can only recommend the hotel. The room was somewhat small, but very clean. The service was very friendly and helpful. And continental breakfast, although not quite gourmet, was included and pretty good. For the price, this must be one of the best places to stay in Toronto. The only reason I don't give this hotel a 5-rating is that it doesn't offer much luxury. But if you want to stay at a nice, clean place close to the subway and the downtown area on a budget, this place is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: betenoire
Reviews.Content: This hotel was almost perfect. Not only is is GORGEOUS on the outside, but it's clean and friendly on the inside. The staff were incredibly personable and helpful. I enjoyed my stay here so much that I actually gave the telephone number and address of the hotel to some people I met on the greyhound who say they visit Toronto frequently. My only complaint is about the bathrooms in the basic rooms. They are so small that a person has to squeeze into the space between the sink and the shower in order to shut the door. Not ideal, but still workable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Isabella”
Reviews.Author: TripAdivsorMember
Reviews.Content: Isabella Hotel and Suites is a great find in Toronto! Can't do better on price and convenience. Hotel is about 2 minutes from the nearest metro stop. Neighborhood has plenty of restuarants and shops. Grocery store less than a block away. Hotel staff is great. Thanks Dann and Gord!!!

Reviews.Title: “RECOMENDED!”
Reviews.Author: peter9702
Reviews.Content: For the money i can definately recomend the hotel.The location is pretty good as its only 2mins to the nearest subway.The staff are very helpful and particularly hardworking.We found the hotel clean,cool,and well equiped,Breakfast was ok,the bar excelent,the foyer was very impressive,and the staff were happy to advise on anything from restaurants to shopping.The room was a bit small but it is downtown Toronto,overall highly recomended!

Reviews.Title: “Not Happy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel Isabella at 2130 to find that there was a booking error. The staff eventually got us into a poky room that was not of the type we had booked, i.e no bath tub and a window that faced a wall 2 ft away and could not be opened. The staff there seemed to suggest that they had performed miracles in getting us in and one member of staff even suggested that she "...should be in the Guinness book of records or something." Just for being able to manipulate a hotel booking system. To add insult to injury, we awoke to find that the breakfast that we had booked would not be served due to the fact that they had "run out of food". The hotel refused to compensate in any way and even suggested that i should be grateful for the effort they had put into manipulating the booking system to get us a room. On the whole disgusted

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cozy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not only is the hotel convienetly located and priced accordingly, the service was impecable. I have stayed their twice and both times the room was extremly clean, room service was prompt (extra blanket) and the bar/patio was enjoyable.Overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overwhelming with Charm and Hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_Estate_Agent
Reviews.Content: I held a 2005 1st annual client "Christmas/Holiday" party at the Isabella hotel. With this being my first client party I was unaware of all the details that needed attention. The staff at the Isabella hotel took time to ensure that every detail was taken care of for me. When my guests started arriving they were greeted in a more than professional manner they were greeted as part of the family. The guests and myself were all pleased with the venue, food and service. I was so pleased, upon checking out I rebooked the same partie details for my 2006 2nd annual client party. The clients who booked a hotel room were all pleased with the cleanliness and comfort offered for such a great price. They also have rebooked their rooms for the "2006 Holiday Party". "Thank you for your help in making my First Annual party a wonderful success". Bryen Daly

Reviews.Title: “Quaint little place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, and most charming. The hotel bar is small, yet inviting. The staff are very friendly and down to earth. We stayed in the suite, which was wonderful. Brighly lit, with all the amenities, we were very impressed and will definitely go back. The Isabella is a stone's throw from all the action downtown, yet does not overcharge as many Toronto hotels do. All our needs were met and we thoroughly enjoyed our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of being a guest at the newly reopened Isabella Hotel and Suites and was impressed from the moment that I walked in. The front desk staff was fast and knowledgeable (thanks for the tip for dinner!), and made my four night stay a treat. I am self employed and appreciate quality. The highlight of my stay were the amazingly friendly conversations with the hotel manager; she was phenomenal and really knows how to treat her guests. I've stayed in many places during my trips to Toronto, but I have found my new favourite! Can't wait for the restaurant to open. See you all soon! VV

HotelInfo.Name: Isabella Hotel and Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 556 Sherbourne St., Toronto, Ontario M4X1L3, Canada
